intro: Alsinanthus montanus, commonly known as the mountain alsine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, adapting it to harsh mountain conditions.
